entry.title: Use SAP Integration Suite to connect SAP and AWS services
entry.content:
Bridging the gap between SAP and 3rd party systems 

Everyone already knows that SAP Integration Suite is the election tool to connect your SAP services. But did you know that it is also your tool to integrate Everything, Everywhere, All in One Place? (yes, almost like the Oscar award winning movie üèÜ)

Use SAP Integration Suite to connect SAP and AWS services is a new official SAP Discovery Center Mission that focus on showcasing how easy it is to integrate not only SAP systems but also non-SAP systems using SAP Integration Suite. 

For this mission, we decided to use the AWS platform as the example of third-party cloud services provider, but the same rational with this set of best practices and capabilities can be used to integrate with other cloud providers. By following the cards provided in the mission, you will see step-by-step how you can start to integrate an application developed with SAP BTP development tools with AWS services, such as S3 for image storage and Rekognition for image identification.
You can even use a SAP BTP Trial account to perform the SAP BTP parts of the mission, even though you will always still require also an AWS account to connect with the S3 and Rekognition services (and IAM for user and roles management on the AWS side). Either if you are a technical user or more of a business user interested in rapid application development, cloud integration strategies and/or AI-powered business solution, this mission is for you!

The following architecture shows the big picture of what the final result of the mission should look like, seamlessly combining the best of both SAP BTP and AWS platforms:

‚ÄÉ

Use Case Description

The use case followed trough out the mission focuses in enabling a Supplier to donate surplus food ingredients through an AI-powered mobile and web application built using SAP Build Apps, a low-code/no-code solution within SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP), seamlessly integrated with AWS capabilities for storage and artificial intelligence‚Äìbased image recognition. For the integration part, you will leverage and combine different integration capabilities that are part of the SAP Integration Suite. The intended outcome of the use case is to minimize food waste while simplifying the donation process and facilitating redistribution to organizations in need.

Solution Components:

  • SAP Build Apps: The low-code/no-code application development service used to create the application (frontend and logic) where the Supplier can donate the surplus ingredients by taking or uploading photos 
  • SAP Integration Suite: The secure and centralized integration management service for all your integrations, making them easier to manage, monitor and troubleshoot
  • Amazon S3: The Amazon service for simplified and cost-effective image storage capabilities
  • Amazon Rekognition: The Amazon service for AI-powered identification and categorization, in this case used to identify the ingredients in the images taken or uploaded from the application to a S3 bucket

The Use Case Flow:

  1. A Supplier captures or uploads an image of surplus ingredients through the mobile/web app (developed with SAP Build Apps)
  2. The image is securely stored in Amazon S3 via SAP Integration Suite (using Cloud Integration, Pre-built Open Connector and API Management capabilities)
  3. Also via SAP Integration Suite, the app then calls Amazon Rekognition to automatically identify and categorize the ingredient present in the image (using Cloud Integration, Custom Open Connector and API Management capabilities)
  4. The results are sent back to the app and ready for further processing

  

Learning Outcomes

By completing this Discovery Center Mission, you'll gain practical experience in:

  • Building low-code applications with SAP Build Apps
  • Configuring SAP Integration Suite for AWS connectivity
  • Implementing secure cloud-to-cloud integrations
  • Leveraging AI services for business process automation
  • Managing integration flows and monitoring capabilities

Getting Started

Once you open and start the Mission, you will see in the Project Board the different cards that will guide you step-by-step, divided in 7 columns.

Make sure you fullfill all the requirements indicated in the SET UP and PREPARE columns. After that, you can start with the EXECUTE columns. You will first explore the Open Connectors capability of SAP Integration Suite (in the Execute - OpenConnectors), followed by the Cloud Integration and API Management capabilities of SAP Integration Suite (in the Execute - Security Material and Integration Flow) and lastly you will get to visually create a simple app screen with SAP Build Apps (in Execute - Build app) .
After finishing the mission, don't forget to mark all the cards as completed and we encourage you to leave your feedback and share your experiences with the rest of the SAP Community. 

And now, for those who saw the movie Everything Everywhere All at Once, DON'T "Just be a rock" and start the mission here!  ->  SAP Discovery Center Missions - Use SAP Integration Suite to connect SAP and AWS services

entry.title: Exploring My Path in the SAP Ecosystem ‚Äî And Rediscovering My Love for Sales
entry.content:
Hello Everyone.

My name is Elizabeth Ali and I am excited to be part of this SAP Learning Community. A little about me: I am a U.S. Army veteran, a project and program manager, and a creative at heart with a background in Fashion Design and Marketing. My path has been unconventional, just like me, but it has allowed me to gain so many skills, insights, strategies, resilience and adaptability along the way.

Throughout my career, I have worked in dynamic, client-facing environments, including supporting high-profile global projects within a PR and marketing agency. Those experiences strengthened my communication, relationship building and problem-solving abilities, and reminded me how much I value work that revolves around people and connection.

I am currently working toward my SAP Certified Associate in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition with the Vower learning group. This journey has been energizing and inspiring. Each lesson opens my mind to new possibilities and helps me understand more about the ecosystem I am stepping into.

Recently I found myself reflecting on the roles I have held and one experience stood out. My time driving sales and working directly with clients at Lush Cosmetics was one of my favorite roles. I loved connecting with people, understanding their needs and helping them feel confident in their decisions. Sales keeps tapping me on the shoulder, so I am turning to the community for insight.

I know there are many paths and opportunities within the sales landscape of SAP and I am exploring where my strengths may naturally align. My background is full of communication, creativity, people-focused work, structure and strategic thinking. I am curious about how all of that could translate into a sales-focused direction within the SAP world.

So I would love to hear from others in this community.
Do you work in sales within the SAP ecosystem?
What part of sales are you in?
What has your path looked like?
What do you enjoy most about the sales side of SAP?

I am genuinely exploring and learning and I truly appreciate hearing real experiences from people already doing this work.

Thank you all for welcoming me. I am excited to learn, connect and grow alongside this community.

Warm regards,
Elizabeth Ali

entry.title: LEFT JOIN LATERAL In DataSphere SQL View
entry.content:
Hello,

Being original a MS SQL writer switching now to DataSphere I'm struggling with the alternavtive for a CROSS APPLY.

I've found some sample on the LEFT JOIN LATERAL, but when I use this code DS always gives errors.

SELECT FT_CURR."FROM_CURR", FT_CURR."TO_CURR"
     , DATES."DATE_SQL"
     , EXCH_DT."EXCH_RATE"
     , EXCH_PRVDT."EXCH_RATE"
  FROM (SELECT DISTINCT "FROM_CURR", "TO_CURR" FROM "EXCHANGERATES") FT_CURR
       CROSS JOIN (SELECT "DATE_SQL" FROM "CENTRAL.2VS_DS_Dates" WHERE "YEAR" = 2025) DATES
       LEFT OUTER JOIN "EXCHANGERATES" EXCH_DT ON EXCH_DT."FROM_CURR" = FT_CURR."FROM_CURR"
                                              AND EXCH_DT."TO_CURR" = FT_CURR."TO_CURR"
                                              AND EXCH_DT."EXCH_DATE" = DATES."DATE_SQL"
       LEFT JOIN LATERAL (SELECT "FROM_CURR", "TO_CURR", "EXCH_DATE", "EXCH_RATE"
                            FROM "EXCHANGERATES"
                           WHERE "FROM_CURR" = "FT_CURR"."FROM_CURR"
                             AND "TO_CURR" = "FT_CURR"."TO_CURR"
                             AND "EXCH_DATE" < "DATES"."DATE_SQL"
                           ORDER BY "EXCH_DATE" DESC
                           LIMIT 1) EXCH_PRVDT ON EXCH_PRVDT."FROM_CURR" = FT_CURR."FROM_CURR"
                                              AND EXCH_PRVDT."TO_CURR" = FT_CURR."TO_CURR"
                                              AND EXCH_PRVDT."EXCH_DATE" < "DATES"."DATE_SQL"

First error is ‚ÄòSELECT‚Äô is a reserved word - write ‚Äò![SELECT]‚Äô instead if you want to use it as name

So I'm not sure DS allows this LATERAL, and if not, what would be an alternative ?

entry.title: Re: 999 ‚Äì The Number of the BSEG
entry.content:
Dear Jitka,

yes, this is a known issue. You define PAOBJNR as "additional document splitting characteristic for controlling" in order to split cash discount items (PAOBJNR-wise) in the payment documents according to the invoices, but then (during the payment) you'll quite easily run into the 999 issue on BSEG...
There's two aspects I want to share:
1) As you correctly assumed, during an F-28 or F-53 payment, no standard summarization code (BAdi or OBCY/OBCYX) will be processed, this holds true for any FB01-like postings. So I could point you to the corresponding payment FIORI apps Clear Incoming Payments or Clear Outgoing Payments instead, where technically the summarization code is at least available. And in fact, in the Public Cloud edition we enhanced the summarization so that for these FIORI apps, these cash discount (and exchange rate differences) items will be automatically summarized on BSEG; problem solved in the Public Cloud..
2) Since I assume we're talking about Private Cloud or On Premise in your case: we did develop an alternative approach already many years ago for this special case (many cash discount items in payments due to PAOBJNR split): please have a look at pilot note 2634485. 

Kind regards,
Stefan

So in order to see this new column inside the Data Product, I would need to create a new Data Product based on the updated view. However, if my view originally contains 100 records and later the source grows to 200 records, then the new data records will be shown in the Data Product (because Live Access always returns the latest data). entry.title: Re: Cannot change Revenue Recognition Key to SPFCSC for C...
entry.content: You cannot freely switch a revenue recognition key once postings or revenue recognition runs have occurred. In SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition, the key must be set correctly at the start of the project/contract item. If you need to move from SPFC to SPFCSC, the supported approach is to create a new project/contract item with the correct key rather than changing it mid‚Äëstream.

entry.title: Re: Standard Table for Listing InfoObjects with Attribute and Text Master Data
entry.content: There is no single Table where in both Attribute and Text master data can be found out with a list of all InfoObjects. However, you can search the individual InfoObjects using the SE11 -> "/BIC/T*" for Text & "/BIC/P*" for Attribute table.

entry.title: Re: Working day
entry.content:
There is no implemented feature which allows to compute a rating event on the fifth working day of each month.

Nevertheless, you can use a daily event in order to implement your needs.
For example, you can count the number of working days by incrementing a counter day after day. As soon as the counter is equal to 5, generate a BIT. Else reach a free component. And a monthly event reset the counter at the end of month.

Regards,

Eric F.

entry.title: Re: F0770 Payment run logs can only be viewed for 6 month...
entry.content:
No, it cannot be changed in Public Cloud. Unlike on‚Äëpremise, where you could adjust archiving or retention settings, Public Cloud follows a fit‚Äëto‚Äëstandard approach. The 6‚Äëmonth limit is fixed and not configurable by customers.

If you need to keep logs longer than 6 months, export the logs regularly. Use the Download or Export to excel option in the F0770 app. Store them in your own archive (SharePoint, OneDrive, or corporate repository).

Leverage CDS views / reporting. Use Payment Run analytical CDS views to extract payment run data into reports. Schedule regular extraction jobs to preserve historical data.

entry.title: Re: Can I merge the schedule lines by vendor?
entry.content:
SAP does not provide a standard transaction to merge or consolidate schedule line data into a single document. The system keeps schedule lines tied to their individual purchase orders or scheduling agreements. If you want a consolidated overview of all schedule lines for a vendor, this typically requires a custom report, CDS view, or enhancement rather than standard functionality

Why because, Schedule lines are designed to reflect delivery dates and quantities at the item level in purchase orders or scheduling agreements. SAP standard tools like ME58, ME59, or ME2x reports focus on PR ‚Üí PO consolidation or PO monitoring, not on merging schedule lines into one document. The system intentionally keeps schedule lines separate to preserve logistics accuracy (each line has its own delivery date, quantity, and confirmation).

entry.title: Re: Control for no transactions until Cost Estimate is Run
entry.content:
SAP does not provide a hard ‚Äúsystem lock‚Äù that prevents postings (like Goods Receipt, GI, billing) until a cost estimate is run. The standard cost estimate (CK40N, CK11N) is primarily used for valuation and variance analysis. Even if no cost estimate exists, you can still post GRs, GIs, or billing documents ‚Äî they will use moving average price or last purchase price for valuation.

Having said that, the recommended Best Practice approach would be

  • Run and release cost estimates before period start (mandatory step in closing cycle).
  • Use custom enhancement (BAdI/User Exit) if you want a hard block on GR or billing until cost estimate exists.
  • Alternatively, enforce through authorization/workflow that logistics postings are not allowed until costing team confirms release.

entry.title: Why IAS Is Essential for Enterprise DIV Implementations (Part 1)
entry.content:
This is Part 1 of a three-part series on setting up SAP Cloud Identity Services ‚Äì Identity Authentication (IAS) with the BTP service Decentralized Identity Verification (DIV). It lays the foundation by explaining what IAS is and why it is a core building block for enterprise-grade DIV implementations.

 

Introduction

Consider a scenario where a global automotive manufacturer has decided to implement SAP‚Äôs Decentralized Identity Verification (DIV) solution to enable secure, privacy-preserving digital identity management across its supply chain. The company needs to issue verifiable credentials to suppliers, partners, and employees while maintaining full control over the authentication infrastructure.

However, there‚Äôs a critical requirement: the organization wants to use its own corporate identity system rather than creating and managing separate user accounts in SAP. Employees and suppliers should authenticate using their existing corporate credentials, such as those from the manufacturer‚Äôs domain or a gearbox supplier‚Äôs identity provider, not additional SAP-specific identities.

Additionally, granular access control is essential. The manufacturer needs to define which users can access specific digital wallets and which administrators have the authority to provision and manage these wallets across different business units and partner organizations. This is where SAP Cloud Identity Services ‚Äì Identity Authentication (IAS) becomes indispensable.

 

What is IAS?

IAS is a cloud-based identity management solution that serves as a central authentication and single sign-on (SSO) hub for SAP and non-SAP applications.

Core Capabilities

  • Single Sign-On (SSO): Users authenticate once and gain access to multiple applications without repeated logins.
  • Identity Federation: IAS can integrate with existing corporate identity providers (like Microsoft Azure AD, Google Workspace, etc.) through standards like SAML 2.0 and OpenID Connect (OIDC). This avoids duplicate user accounts.
  • Fine-Grained Access Control: Users can be assigned access to specific applications or resources‚Äîcritical for multi-tenant DIV wallet scenarios.
  • Centralized User Lifecycle Management: Manage users, groups, authentication policies, and access rights consistently across systems.

 

Why Use IAS with DIV?

While DIV can technically operate without IAS, enterprise deployments strongly benefit from it. IAS addresses three core challenges: identity reuse, access control, and security.

1. Reusing Existing Corporate Identities

Most organizations already operate mature identity systems. IAS allows DIV to integrate seamlessly by:

  • Federating with corporate and partner identity providers
  • Eliminating DIV-specific user accounts
  • Simplifying onboarding and offboarding: disabling a corporate account automatically revokes DIV access

This ensures users authenticate with familiar credentials while IT retains centralized control.

2. Granular Access Control in Multi-Tenant Environments

In realistic enterprise scenarios, different stakeholders require different levels of access. Consider the automotive manufacturer example: The finance department needs access to a dedicated wallet tenant for financial audit credentials. The supply chain team requires access to supplier verification credentials in a separate tenant while quality assurance must access quality certification credentials without visibility into financial or HR data. Furthermore, an external gearbox supplier should only access the specific wallet tenant designated for supplier interactions.

IAS enables this sophisticated access model through:

  • Group-based access control mapped to DIV wallet tenants
  • Role-based administrative permissions for provisioning and management
  • Tenant isolation, preventing unauthorized access across departments or partners

3. Centralized Security and Auditability

Without IAS, organizations would need to manage separate authentication mechanisms for DIV, adding complexity and risk. IAS provides:

  • Central enforcement of security policies (e.g. MFA, password rules, session timeouts)
  • Reduced credential sprawl and fewer attack surfaces
  • Improved visibility into authentication activity for security monitoring and audits

 

What this Series Will Build

To provide concrete context throughout this series, the following scenario is used: an automotive manufacturer implementing DIV with the following requirements:

Authentication:

  1. Employees from the manufacturing company authenticate using their corporate domain credentials
  2. Partner organizations (such as a gearbox supplier) authenticate using their own identity systems, federated through IAS
  3. Authentication is mandatory before opening any DIV wallet or accessing the DIV provisioning interface

Authorization:

  1. Define which employees can open which wallet tenants (e.g., finance employees cannot access HR credential wallets)
  2. Define which administrators from the manufacturer can provision wallet tenants
  3. Define which administrators from partner organizations (like gearbox supplier) can manage their own supplier wallets
  4. Map corporate roles to predefined DIV user roles and permissions

Outcome:

The manufacturer maintains full control over user identities, access rights, and administrative boundaries while enabling seamless integration with partner organizations‚Äô identity systems using IAS.

 

Read more

‚û°Ô∏è   Continue with Creating and Accessing an IAS Tenant on SAP BTP (Part 2)

‚û°Ô∏è‚û°Ô∏è   Jump to Connecting IAS with SAP Decentralized Identity Verification (Part 3)

  • Self-Sovereign Identity (SSI): A Usage Catalyst for Data Spaces 
  • Feature Scope Description for Decentralized Identity Verification (help page)
  • What Are Cloud Identity Services? (help page)

entry.title: Alumna de ICESI, Colombia, ganadora en Hack4SAP organizado por Indra Group | Minsait y SAP

entry.title: Re: @sap/cds v9.6 event queue issue
entry.content:
If possible, can we verify the tokenStore handle for @SAP/cds/libx/_runtime/messaging/enterprise-messaging.js,  line 158 (handle function)

We're passing a empty tokenStore: {} object, which, make the service fetch the token every time we emit a message. Normally, this is not an issues, but in high volume of event, this cause a lot 429 error when fetch token, and slow down the whole application.

entry.title: SAC Data Action: DELETE() with IF condition not working
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I‚Äôm encountering a specific issue with a Data Action in SAP Analytics Cloud and I‚Äôm looking for some guidance.

I have a DataAction that performs a DELETE operation based on an IF condition involving two dimensions. 

When I define the MEMBERSET using the "All" node (root) of the hierarchy, the Data Action does not execute the delete as expected (it seems to ignore the scope or fail the condition). However, if I explicitly list the leaf members (ID values) of the dimension in the MEMBERSET, the script works perfectly and the data is deleted.

Is there a known limitation regarding the use of hierarchy nodes within IF conditions or DELET blocks ? How can I make the Data Action dynamic enough to include all members of a hierarchy without hardcoding every ID, while still respecting the IF logic?

Thanks in advance for your help!

Here is my code : 

MEMBERSET [d/Measures] = ("Value")
MEMBERSET [d/DIMENSION_ACCOUNT] = ("ACCOUNT1","ACCOUNT2")
MEMBERSET [d/DIMENSION_DATASOURCE] = "INPUT"

//MEMBERSET [d/DIMENSION_MATERIAL] = BASEMEMBER([d/DIMENSION_MATERIAL].[h/MATERIAL_HIER],%MAT% )
//MEMBERSET [d/DIMENSION_MATERIAL] = BASEMEMBER([d/DIMENSION_MATERIAL].[h/_MATERIAL_HIER],"[00224].[1779334]" )
MEMBERSET [d/DIMENSION_MATERIAL] = BASEMEMBER([d/DIMENSION_MATERIAL].[h/MATERIAL_HIER],"(all)" )

//MEMBERSET [d/DIMENSION_TECHNICAL_KEY] = BASEMEMBER([d/DIMENSION_TECHNICAL_KEY].[h/DIMENSION_TECHNICAL_KEY_HIER] ,"[1779332].[2002-1779332]" )
MEMBERSET [d/DIMENSION_TECHNICAL_KEY] = BASEMEMBER([d/DIMENSION_TECHNICAL_KEY].[h/DIMENSION_TECHNICAL_KEY_HIER] ,"(all)" )

entry.title: Re: 999 ‚Äì The Number of the BSEG
entry.content:
Hello obul776,

well, the FIORI app Post General Journal Entries is a manual posting triggered from FI, it's the "modern" replacement for transactions FB01 or FB50, so it's "FIN Operations". As explained above, for these manual FI postings, we do want to keep the detailed BSEGs (just as they were typed in) as "entry view" or "prima nota" document, please consider them an extended screenshot of the stuff you typed in. We don't want to summarize BSEG in this case, otherwise we would lose the "entry view" information. And, provocative question: who wants to key in manually more than 999 line items?
So again: for manual FI postings, no standard BSEG summarization will ever be performed, standard BSEG summarization is just for postings triggered from outside FI.
Now, if we're talking about the Upload General Journal Entries FIORI app (where you can upload a spreadsheet of General Journal entries), then one could argue: the "entry view" or "prima nota" is represented by the Excel file itself, the "prima nota" lies outside of the S/4HANA system, there's no need to duplicate this prima nota internally on the BSEG; moreover, uploading spreadsheets with more than 999 items is definitely a valid scenario, this is not manual work any more.
I personally maintained this opinion for many years, and a few months ago we added a button with the options "Suppress BSEGs" or "Summarize BSEGs to the maximum" to the Upload General Journal Entries app. At least in the Public Cloud edition.
In the Private Cloud edition, you could e.g. use the standard BAPIs or Journal Entry Post SOAP APIs for mass upload; here the summarization BAdi will be triggered.

Kind regards,
Stefan

entry.title: How to prepare server to use Sybase Adaptive Server Enterprise (ASE) Database for CMS
entry.content:
How to configure system to use Sybase ASE Database for CMS
Prerequisites to configure, before using Sybase ASE Database for CMS

Prerequisite before installing BI with Sybase ASE.

  • Get the database connection details from the Sybase Database Team.
  • We should have below details :
    • DB Host:Port
    • SID/Service_name
    • DB Account/password

Installing the Sybase ASE Client.

  • Download the Sybase ASE client from the software downloads.
  • Access https://me.sap.com/softwarecenter 
    • In the search box: SDK FOR SAP ASE

       

  • Select the Version and Download the same.
    • Run the installer and you will see 3 options: Typical / Full / Custom



       

    • Select Custom and choose below and Install the client


       

Setting the Environment Variable, POST Installation of Sybase ASE Client.

  • We should see under the Install Directory of Sybase ASE, file named SYBASE.bat
  • Which has information about the environment Variable.  We need to set the same.

    • Below is the sample, Assuming that the Sybase Client is has been installed under: C:\SYBASE

      set SAP_JRE8_32=C:\SYBASE\Shared\SAPJRE-8_1_102_32BIT
      set SAP_JRE8=C:\SYBASE\Shared\SAPJRE-8_1_102_64BIT
      set SAP_JRE8_64=C:\SYBASE\Shared\SAPJRE-8_1_102_64BIT
      set SYBASE_OCS=OCS-16_1
      set INCLUDE=C:\SYBASE\OCS-16_1\include;%INCLUDE%
      set LIB=C:\SYBASE\OCS-16_1\lib;%LIB%
      set PATH=C:\SYBASE\OCS-16_1\bin;C:\SYBASE\OCS-16_1\dll;C:\SYBASE\OCS-16_1\lib3p64;C:\SYBASE\OCS-16_1\lib3p;%PATH%
      set SYBASE=C:\SYBASE
      set PATH=C:\SYBASE\DataAccess\ODBC\dll;%PATH%
      set PATH=C:\SYBASE\DataAccess64\ODBC\dll;%PATH%
      set SYBROOT=C:\SYBASE
  • Once the environment variable are been set, Please restart the OS to take effect.
  • Post restart confirm if the variables have been set correctly or not.

    • Running Below command in Command Prompt will help us understand
      echo %PATH%
      echo %LIB%

POST setting the Environment Variable : Configuring the interfaces / Connectivity to the Sybase ASE Database.

  • Open the Dsedit.exe or in the start Menu Search for Open Client Directory Service Editor
  • Navigate to the Server Object > Add > 
  • In the Input Server Name: Add the SID/ Service Name that was provided by the Database Team.

     

  • On the Entry has been added, Select the Server Name and click on the last Attribute (Server Address)
  • Right Click and Modify

     

  • Choose Protocol TCP and in the Network Address Add: <HOSTNAME>,<PORT> of the Sybase ASE Database.
  • Once Done, Select any Attribute and right click on it and Select Ping Server. Or Navigate to Server Object Tab and under dropdown select Ping Server
  • You should get an message:
    Ping to <Hostname,Port> using protocol TCP
    Connection succeeded.
  • You can also check the sql.ini file. Under <Install_dir_sybase_client>/ini/sql.ini
  • There should be entries like below:

    [ServiceName/SID]
    master=TCP,Database_host,Database_port
    query=CP,Database_host,Database_port

  • SID/ Service Name would be the same as provided by Sybase ASE DB Team and the one mentioned in the Dsedit.

Checking Connectivity using isql

  • Running below command from Command prompt :
    isql -SServiceName -Uusername -Ppassword
  • If isql command is not getting recognized, it means the environment variable has not been set correctly.

entry.title: Leave Accrual Customization Based on Year to Year
entry.content:
Dear Community Member,

I hope this message finds you well.

I would like to bring to your attention a critical requirement from my client regarding leave accrual customization on year to year

Here is the requirement

We have a leave type called ‚ÄúAnniversary Leave‚Äù where the accrual will happen on the anniversary date which is happening but however client want when employee completes 5 years/10 years/15 years the leave accrual should happened on Anniversary Date but for rest year i.e on 6th Year/7th Year/8th Year/9th Year leave should accrued on 1st Jan of that particular year not on anniversary date.

 Example: For an employee with a DOJ of 16/04/2020, 1 extra leave day will be added on 16/04/2025(On Completion of 5 years), which is working correctly as per current configuration but twist is here

From the following year onward, Anniversary Leave will be accrued on January 1st of each year instead of the anniversary day.

For example:

  • In 2026, 2027, 2028 & 2029, leave will be added on 01/01/2026, 01/01/2027, 01/01/2028 & 01/01/2029 respectively
  • For the 10-year milestone, the employee will again receive the Anniversary Leave on their actual anniversary date (not on January 1st).

Example: On 16/04/2030, 2 extra anniversaries leave days will be added.

  • After the 10-year milestone, the same rule applies: for the consecutive years following the 10-year anniversary, leave will be accrued on January 1st of each year (e.g., 2031, 2032, 2033 & 2034).

Can we achieve this?

Thanks!

entry.title: Re: Regarding to Manager of Last Approver of Supplier Inv...
entry.content:
Hi @yukitsumura ,

I am not fully certain at which stage the agent is triggered for the manager as the final approver. However, instead of assigning this role at the first approval level, it is recommended to assign it at the second approval level. This approach increases the likelihood that the workflow will be triggered for the last approver (manager).

The Manage Workforce app is used to extend the User ID (Business Partner) to an Employee ID. Once this activity is completed, you can use the User ID directly instead of a role during workflow configuration. This allows you to assign approvals more precisely at the user level.

If you need any clarification on this setup, feel free to add a comment here.

Regards,

Vinith.K

entry.title: Re: Behind the Curtains - what's new about Maintenance Certificates
entry.content:
Hi Dirk, 

thanks a lot for the further explanations. Please note that the communication with the hostagent is only working if there is an active http port existing in the ABAP System. For SSL only configurations the process is not properly working at the moment. A flag in the config if the hostagent is only available via 1129 would be greatly appreciated. Otherwise we need to configure a icm port 0 with http for this outgoing connection.

Federation itself works like a charm once setup, this is a nice feature especially in hardened environments. We noted though that the proxy access through the federation lead also throws errors when the lead is installed on a host without a SAP Instance is used, for example in a DMZ scenario. 
This is an excerpt from the sapsbproxy.log:

*** ERROR => DlLoadLib()==DLENOACCESS - dlopen("/usr/sap//SYS/exe/run/libsapcrypto.so") FAILED
"/usr/sap//SYS/exe/run/libsapcrypto.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory" [dlux_mt.c 445]
*** ERROR => SapSecuInit: could not load libsapsecu >/usr/sap//SYS/exe/run/libsapcrypto.so< [secuload.c 554]
We can also open a ticket regarding these issues.

BR

Michael

entry.title: Re: Mass Download of Balance Confirmations
entry.content:
Hello again,

Here's what the expert replied:

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition, Customer Balance Confirmation and Supplier Balance Confirmation letters are typically dispatched either physically (hard copy/printed) or electronically via email with an attached PDF document. This can be configured through the output parameter settings by selecting the output channel as either PRINT or EMAIL.

In both cases, users do not need to download the PDF version of the confirmation letters‚Äîthat is, the system doesn't require or expect users to manually download these documents during normal operations. The PDF download feature remains available but is intended only for rare or special situations, such as when someone needs to review the confirmation for a particular customer or supplier.  A mass download functionality is not supported.

If you require a mass download of Customer or Supplier Balance Confirmation letters, please submit a feature request detailing your specific use case. Alternatively, if your goal is to process the Balance Confirmations further, you could consider requesting additional output channels such as XML or EDI instead of requesting a mass download.

Best regards,

Henrike

entry.title: Re: UoM changed in Va02 not reflecting in MB51
entry.content:
Updating MSEG entries directly through enhancements is not advisable. These tables are part of SAP‚Äôs core inventory accounting and manipulating them artificially will cause serious inconsistencies between logistics, FI/CO, and audit trails.

Instead of trying to force MB51 to show sales order changes, the right approach is to use SD reporting tools (e.g., sales order item reports, document flow, or custom CDS views) to track UoM changes at the order level. MB51 should remain strictly for material movements.

If the business requirement is to see ‚Äúreserved stock‚Äù in the new UoM, build a custom report or Fiori app that reads from the sales order tables (VBAP, VBEP) and shows the reservation quantities in the desired UoM. This way, you meet the reporting need without compromising SAP‚Äôs core integrity.

entry.title: Problem with RUM Release Upgrade Management Support
entry.content:
Hello,

I need assistance. I have no communication with support for RUM (Release Upgrade Management). I will describe the issue step by step.

  1. On 18.12.2025, an Upgrade Project request was created with a planned start date of 12.01.2026 and was automatically taken over by SAP for further processing.

  2. The review by SAP was sent very late, only on 13.01.2026, after the planned start date had already passed. The project was returned with the status Customer Managed and IN PLANNING.
    The IN PLANNING status is not correct; it should be IN PREPARATION. Due to this incorrect status and the late response from SAP, we do not have access to the task list, nor are we able to properly fine-tune the timeline.

  3. Since the project was returned to us for further processing significantly late, on 16.01.2026 we set a new start date to 23.01.2026. This was the only change we were able to make because the status is IN PLANNING. After saving the change, I do not see that this update is visible to SAP RUM support. How can we get the project status changed to IN PREPARATION? How should we continue with our work?

I contacted the email address itsm.notification-service@sap.com requesting a correction on the SAP side and a renewed review of the project, as the delayed response from SAP resulted in us missing the originally planned start date. We received a reply stating that technical support can be contacted via this platform, but no further assistance was provided.

Project ID: 2301

Regards,

Andjelka Jankovic

entry.title: Using FileAdapter in SAP HANA SDI for SAP PaPM Cloud
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community! Welcome to this blogpost on how to use FileAdapter in SAP HANA Smart Data Integration (SDI) for SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud integration. 

In our earlier blog on SAP PaPM Cloud Integration with Microsoft Excel, we explored how ExcelAdapter can help business users to bring their Excel file data directly into the SAP PaPM Cloud.

But what happens when your data is not in an Excel file? What if your data is coming in the form of *.csv, *.txt or a tab-delimited file? How can we consume the data in our SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud?

This is where HANA SDI‚Äôs FileAdapter comes in.

Before walking through the steps on how to set up FileAdapter for SAP PaPM Cloud Inbound Integration. Here's a quick comparison between FileAdapter and ExcelAdapter:

Comparison

FileAdapter

ExcelAdapter

File Type

*.csv, *.txt, logs

*.xls, *.xlsx

Structure

Delimited (commas, tabs, pipes) 

Tabular, sheet-based

Best For

Raw exports, transactional data

Spreadsheet, planning models

Special Features

Pattern-based reading, real-time replication

Sheet/range selection, metadata handling

Complexity

Requires config file (.cfg) for parsing

More intuitive if you're used to Excel

 

Prerequisites:

  • SAP HANA Data Provisioning Agent is installed and connected to SAP PaPM Cloud. See Data Provisioning Agent Installation and Update Guide and Configuration Guide for SAP HANA Cloud.
  • Register Data Provisioning Adapter for FileAdapter. See Register Data Provisioning Adapters
  • Prepare your source file in a *.csv or *.txt file. Make sure it has headers (column names) and consistent delimiters (commas, tabs or pipes)

Step 1: Create Configuration File in the Data Provisioning Agent

Open a command prompt as Administrator and navigate to <DPAgent_DIR>/agentutils directory. Execute the command to create a configuration file (*.cfg) to tell FileAdapter how to interpret your source file. See Generate the Configuration File with a Command-Line Utility.

createfileformat.bat -file "<CSV folder path>\filename.csv" -firstRowAsColumnName true -cfgdir "<CSV folder path>"

 

Step 2: Prepare Configuration File

The first line in your Configuration File should always include a comment or a description. For further guidance, see File Format Configuration Files

 

Step 3: Configure FileAdapter Preference

Next step is to authenticate the file using AccessToken. To retrieve the AccessToken, open a Command Prompt and enter command: whoami /user. Make sure to record the Security Identifier (SID) as this will be required later in the FileAdapter Preference configuration.

Once we have the SID information, open a Command Prompt as Administrator and go to <DPAgent_Dir>/bin and enter command: agentcli.bat ‚ÄìconfigAdapters. When prompted, select Option 2 (Set Adapter Preference) then proceed to choose Option 7 (Set FileAdapter Preference). Provide the following information:

Fields

Value

Root Directory

No remote source can reach beyond this directory for data files. This means that you must use this folder/subfolder for remote source configuration

File Format For Root Directory

No remote source can reach beyond this directory for data files. This means that you must use this folder/subfolder for remote source configuration

Access Token

An access token protects the files from access from different agents. Use this password when creating a remote source.

 

Step 4: Set up Remote Source Connection in the SAP HANA Cloud

Go to the HANA Database Explorer of the PaPM Cloud application and set up a Remote Source Connection. Enter the specified values in the corresponding fields.

FIELDS

VALUE

Source Name

Provide source name for the remote connection

Adapter Name

FileAdapter

Source Location

Select the name of the registered DPAgent

Source Option

Local File System

Target Option

Local File System

Root Directory

<CSV Folder Location>

Directory of the file format definitial

<CSV Folder Location>

Use Decryption for Reading

None

Credentials Mode

Technical User

Password

Enter the Security Identifier (SID)

 

Step 5: Map the File to Virtual Table

Create Virtual Table for the file by selecting the remote source connection and locating the corresponding table for the CSV file, and then click Create Virtual Object(s) to generate the Virtual Table.

Create a name for the virtual table and choose the Schema where it will be store, and then, click Create.

 

Open the content of the Virtual Table to see the contents. Note that in the contents additional columns (PATH, NAME, ROWNUMBER, ERROR and PARTITION) are automatically generated.

 

Step 6: Consume in SAP PaPM Cloud

In the SAP PaPM Cloud, you can now proceed to use the virtual table as an input function and your SAP PaPM Cloud can now pull in data directly from the file source.

Standard Model

Refer to Accessing Artifacts from External SAP HANA Cloud Schema to make your schema accessible as an authoring schema in HANA views or table connections in SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model.

Universal Model

Refer to Accessing Artifacts from External SAP HANA Cloud Schema to make your schema accessible as an authoring schema in HANA views or table connections in SAP PaPM Cloud Universal Model.

Also, for Universal Model, when creating a connection of type ‚ÄúHANA Schema‚Äù, you may encounter the following error:

This error happens because the ROWNUMBER field (automatically generated when using FileAdapter) cannot be used as a valid key field in SAP PaPM Cloud Universal Model. SAP PaPM Cloud Universal Model requires key fields to be either UUID or String type. Since the ROWNUMBER field is of type Integer64, SAP PaPM Cloud Universal Model fails to sync.

To successfully activate the Environment when using FileAdapter in SAP PaPM Cloud Universal Model, you need to complete the following steps:

1. In the Environment, add a UUIDME field as a characteristic with type UUID

2. Under Connection, replace the Model Field ROWNUMBER to UUIDME. Then, click Apply to save your changes. 

 3. Perform Model Sync and Connection Sync. Then, proceed to activate your environment.

4. Once the environment is activated successfully, you may proceed to check the HANA schema and show the data without any issues.

And that's how you can use FileAdapter in SAP HANA SDI for your SAP PaPM Cloud integration! Thank you for sticking with me on this walkthrough! Try it out in your own environments and let us know how it goes. Share your experiences, tips, or questions in the comments section. Let's keep learning and growing together!

entry.title: Re: Configuring Multi-Time-Zone Support in SAP SuccessFac...
entry.content:
Hi hyeongeun_lee,

SAP SuccessFactors supports multiple time zones.

The public profile time zone in SuccessFactors comes from the Timezone field in the User Data File (UDF), which in turn comes from the Timezone of the Job info, and that in turn comes from the Location (Foundation Object) of the job info. For more details about this topic, please check this KBA - 2080587 - How to Sync Correct Timezone to Public Profile in Employee Central.

I hope this helps.

Thank you.

Best Regards,

Karen Perez

entry.title: New Events for Outbound Nota Fiscal
entry.content:
Hi everyone!  

Today, I would like to share with you some impactful insights directly from an SAP Note, which outlines a streamlined approach for sending the events listed in the NF-e Technical Note 2025.002 v1.30, published October 2025. 

You can implement these changes in the outbound invoicing option for Brazil by following the instructions on SAP Note‚ÄØ3692197 and SAP Note 3689265. 

Check out the latest updates and features in our What's New session on the SAP Help Portal: 

  • SAP S/4HANA:‚ÄØNew Events for Outbound Nota Fiscal 
  • SAP ERP:‚ÄØNew Events for Outbound Nota Fiscal 

The Process 

To send these events, you need to create a specific structure, as described in the "Manual da SEFAZ". You should create the new structure through the SEND_GENERIC_EVENT method from the CL_NFE_CLOUD_NFE_PROCESSOR class. This effectively sends the events using the IS_GENERIC_EVENT parameter, which is essential for declaring the structure. 

You have to name this structure as ZNFE_MAP_EVENT_XXXXXX. You replace the XXXXXX for the number of supported events from the NF-e Technical Note 2025.002 v1.30. For example: ZNFE_MAP_EVENT_112110.  

In this structure, you'll find control fields and event-specific fields that are mapped directly to the XML event. You have to build the DET_EVENTO structure, which can vary depending on the type of event. The field names differ between the backend system and their appearance in the cloud solution. Check the following example:  

The structure of the event 112110 (Informa√ß√£o de efetivo pagamento integral para liberar cr√©dito presumido do adquirente) is denoted as ZNFE_MAP_EVENT_112110. This structure has the following string fields and their equivalent in the cloud solution, following the rules of name conversion: 

  • ATTR_VERSAO -> converted to a__versao to create the XML (you can check the rule to create XML attributes instead of elements in SAP Note 3692197) 
  • DESC_EVENTO -> descEvento 
  • C_ORGAO_AUTOR -> cOrgaoAutor 
  • TP_AUTOR -> tpAutor 
  • VER_APLIC -> verAplic 

Check the XML file obtained after the name conversion. To download the XML file, follow the steps mentioned in SAP Note‚ÄØ3692197.  

<detEvento versao="1"> 
   <descEvento>Informa√ß√£o de efetivo pagamento integral para liberar cr√©dito presumido do adquirente</descEvento> 
   <cOrgaoAutor>35</cOrgaoAutor> 
   <tpAutor>1</tpAutor> 
   <verAplic>1</verAplic> 
   <indQuitacao>1</indQuitacao> 
</detEvento>

DET_EVENTO Structure Declaration 

Create the structure‚ÄØ ZNFE_MAP_EVENT_112110. Ensure the structure matches the following definition: 

TYPES: 
  BEGIN OF ZNFE_MAP_EVENT_112110, 
    a__versao        TYPE string, " XML Attribute 
    desc_evento      TYPE string, 
    c_orgao_autor    TYPE string, 
    tp_autor         TYPE string, 
    ver_aplic        TYPE string, 
    ind_quitacao     TYPE string, 
  END OF ZNFE_MAP_EVENT_112110.

Populating DET_EVENTO 

You populate‚ÄØthe DET_EVENTO‚ÄØ using assignment based on input parameters of the program. Check the following example: 

DATA : ls_event_112110 TYPE ZNFE_MAP_EVENT_112110. 
ls_event_112110-a__versao = p_ver.         " Version - XML attribute 
ls_event_112110-desc_evento = p_desc.     " Event description 
ls_event_112110-c_orgao_autor = p_orgaut. " Author organization code 
ls_event_112110-tp_autor = p_tpaut.       " Type of authority 
ls_event_112110-ver_aplic = p_verapp.     " Application version 
ls_event_112110-ind_quitacao = p_indqui.  " Settlement indicator

Steps to Send a Generic Event 

Step 1: Declare and Populate IS_GENERIC_EVENT 

The IS_GENERIC_EVENT structure contains high-level control fields required for all types of events, including details such as issuing state, issuer's CNPJ, and access key (P_ACCKEY). Use the following template to populate the structure: 

DATA : ls_generic_event        TYPE nfe_cloud_nfe_map_gnrc_evt. 
ls_generic_event-uuid                = lo_uuid_generator->generate_uuid( ). " Unique identifier 
ls_generic_event-authorize_uuid      = p_authid.                           " Reference UUID 
ls_generic_event-issuing_state       = p_state.                           " State code 
ls_generic_event-environment_type    = 'HOMOLOGATION'.                    " Environment 
ls_generic_event-issuing_type        = 'NORMAL'.                          " Issuing type 
ls_generic_event-issuer_identifier   = p_issuer.                          " Issuer CNPJ 
ls_generic_event-receiver_identifier = '74544297000192'.                " Receiver CNPJ

Step 2: Declare and Populate Specific DET_EVENTO 

Based on the event type (P_TYPE), decide the specific structure for DET_EVENTO. For example: 

If P_TYPE = '112110', use the predefined structure ZNFE_MAP_EVENT_112110: 

DATA : ls_event_112110 TYPE ZNFE_MAP_EVENT_112110. 
ls_event_112110-a__versao = p_ver.         " Attributes mapped as XML attributes 
ls_event_112110-desc_evento = p_desc. 
ls_event_112110-c_orgao_autor = p_orgaut. 
ls_event_112110-tp_autor = p_tpaut. 
ls_event_112110-ver_aplic = p_verapp. 
ls_event_112110-ind_quitacao = p_indqui. 
ls_generic_event-event_info-det_evento->* = ls_event_112110.  " Assigning DET_EVENTO structure

Step 3: Send the Event 

Invoke the SEND_GENERIC_EVENT method:

TRY. 
  ls_result = lo_processor->send_generic_event( 
      is_generic_event       = ls_generic_event 
      is_company_definition  = ls_company_defition ). 
CATCH cx_nfe_cloud_invalid_value INTO lx_invalid_value. 
  lx_invalid_value->raise_message( ). 
  RETURN. 
ENDTRY.

Checking Event Status 

To verify the status of sent events, follow these steps: 

  1. Service Locator: Use CREATE_SERVICE_LOCATOR_OBJECT from the CL_J_1BNFE_CF_MONITOR class. 
  1. Service Type Parameter: Reference C_SERVICE_EVENT_STATUS from CL_J_1BNFE_CF_CONSTANT. 
  1. Map Events and Generate JSON: Utilize the STRUCTURE_SERIALIZATION method from CL_J_1BNFE_CF_EVENT_UPDATE. 
  1. Client and OA2C Creation: Use SET_REQUEST_JSON and SEND_REQUEST_TO_CLOUD methods from CL_J_1BNFE_CF_SERVICE_COMM. 
  1. Transform JSON Response: Apply GET_RESPONSE_FROM_CLOUD to convert the response into an NF-e format. 
  1. Develop Response Structure: EVENT_TABLE_DESERIALIZATION method helps integrate this into an NF-e structure. 

Building Your Application 

Beyond these steps, you'll need to develop or extend your applications to: 

  • Fill in necessary event data. 
  • Trigger creation and submission based on business processes. 
  • Implement error handling, logging, and monitoring according to your compliance standards. 

That's a wrap for today! I hope this guide serves as a handy reference for anyone navigating the intricacies of sending events in SAP. Stay tuned for more insights and happy coding! 

Until next time,

Nat√°lia

SAP e-Invoicing Application Engineer
